intro: Hedypnois vulgaris, commonly known as the common hedypnois, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia, where it thrives in temperate climates. Hedypnois vulgaris is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
